posts.title: Fayetteville Allocates $1.5M in ARPA Funds To Help With Rising Childcare Costs
posts.content:
Fayetteville is addressing the rising childcare costs by expanding its childhood assistance program with $1.5 million in ARPA funds dedicated to providing eligible recipients with up to 12 monthly payments for childcare.

  • Investing in care: The city's support for the industry is crucial to alleviating the high demand for childcare and hard-to-come-by staffing, often resulting in families being waitlisted for months.
  • Consider the cost: Childcare is often one of the most significant monthly expenses for families, impacting low-income families or those with multiple kids in childcare the most.

Read more on the story HERE.

posts.title: Tyson Foods & America's Car-Mart Among Top US Companies For Diversity
posts.content:
Northwest Arkansas-based Tyson Foods and America's Car-Mart each made Newsweek's America's Greatest Workplaces 2023 for Diversity, a list of 1,000 companies that received top scores from employees on respecting and celebrating diversity. 

  • Employees speak up: The list was compiled after gathering data from public sources, HR professionals, and a survey of 350,000 employees from large companies. 
  • Better business: Car-Mart CEO Jeffrey Williams shared that their commitment to inclusion "allows our associates to thrive, and also for us to deliver best-in-class products and services to our customers and communities."

See Newsweek's list HERE.

posts.title: Walmart Saw Biggest Sales Month In Company History Last Year
posts.content:
Walmart's FY23 Earnings Report revealed strong sales during the holiday season, with full-year sales up 6.7% compared to the prior year. 

  • Substantial numbers: Full-year revenue came in at $611b, with adjusted earnings per share at $6.29, both exceeding expectations. December was the biggest sales month in Walmart's history, led by food sales. 
  • Realistic forecast: With increasing interest rates and a shift in sales towards more budget-friendly options, the company expects a slowdown for the coming fiscal year. 

Read more from Talk Business & Politics HERE.

posts.title: New Facility Will Multiply Impact Of Samaritan Community Center
posts.topic: Sponsored by Hark at Excellerate Foundation
posts.content:
Samaritan Community Center has served the hurting and hungry in NWA with dignity and compassion for over two decades. In 2022, SCC served over 55,000 meals, provided over $600,000 in free dental care, and distributed 207,490 snack packs to NWA schoolchildren. 

  • New home base: The nonprofit plans to open a new 40,000 sqft facility at the corner of Pleasant Grove Rd and Hwy 71-B in Rogers, complete with a mental health counseling center, dental center, a teaching kitchen, 4-acre farm, and collaborative care center for free services and classes. 
  • The gift of growth: With 96% of funds raised for the $16.8m facility, doors should open by Sept 2023, so be on the lookout for an even more significant impact from Samaritan Community Center.

Donations are currently worth double, thanks to a challenge grant! Join the mission HERE.

posts.title: PACRIDGE Brings Regenerative Farming To Northwest Arkansas
posts.content:
Canadaian-based Pacific Ridge is expanding operations to Northwest Arkansas, intending to bring regenerative soil-to-shelf farming practices to more farmers, retailers, and consumers with transparency and technology. 

  • Sustainability mission: The farmer-owned company and partners with the True Crops farming community to lead transformative environmental & corporate sustainability efforts and supply quality, sustainable plant-based foods, beverages, and ingredients.
  • Branching out: The headquarters of the company's US operations will soon open in Northwest Arkansas at a facility in North Rogers, and plans to hire a group of local talent in sales, marketing, EDI, and logistics to help grow PACRIDGE's influence in the States.

Read more on PACRIDGE's expansion HERE.
